billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO HOUSING, CONSTRUCTION AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT

title: Redefines "shelter rent" in computing the tax exemption for limited-profit housing companies
summary: Excludes payment of shelter rent taxes from the definition of shelter rent for purposes of computing the tax exemption allowed limited-profit (Mitchell-Lama) housing companies.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2320

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the private housing finance law, in relation to tax
exemption for limited-profit housing
companies

PURPOSE/SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill would amend subdivision
1 of section 33 of the Private Housing Finance Law to change the
definition of shelter rent to exclude payment of shelter rent taxes.

JUSTIFICATION:
This bill would alleviate an inequitable system of
taxation now imposed on the Mitchell-Lama cooperators. The present
practice of including shelter rent tax in the base on which further
increases in shelter rent are calculated represents an administrative
excess on the part of the City of New York. This results in a tax
being imposed on a tax, in violation of sound fiscal policy.

EXISTING LAW:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
